com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface changeShipmentContainer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface changeShipmentContainer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeShipmentContainer(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The changeShipmentContainer API updates a shipment container.

    • Method Detail

      • changeShipmentContainer

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeShipmentContainer(YFSEnvironment env,
                                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                             java.rmi.RemoteException

        The changeShipmentContainer API updates a shipment container. The updated container is examined and only changed values are applied. If a TransactionId is provided then the status of the container will be updated depending upon the value of BaseDropStatus and AcceptOutOfSequenceUpdates. If the container does not exist and Action on the container is not Delete then createShipmentContainer API is called. If TransactionId is not passed or a container is not getting created then CHANGE_CONTAINER Transaction ID will be used for changing a container that is provided in the factorysetup. Upon deleting a container the inventory will be updated for the quantity placed in that container.

        For Example,

          A ContainerDetail is created with a Quantity value of 10. Later, the Quantity value is changed to 8. The caller program does not need to know what changed; the entire container can be passed with whatever state it is in and the changeShipmentContainer API determines, validates and updates the changes and all relevant databases.

        Only changed attribute values are validated.

        If the pack process of the Shipment is getting completed as part of this transaction, then all the planned tasks for the Shipment which are planned for Expected Pick Date is marked complete.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        The following user exit is called before performing any operations on the input XML passed to this API:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeChangeShipmentContainerUE.
        If ContainerScm is void and GenerateContainerScm is set then the following user exit is called to get the ContainerScm:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetNextSCMUE.
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPDetermineTaskTypeUE.
        The following user exit is invoked for container weight computation/re-computation:
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetOverridenAttributesForShipmentLineItemUE

        Events Raised:
        Event raised under the transaction CHANGE_CONTAINER

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised for the container upon successful execution of changeShipmentContainer.
            Data published - YDM_CHANGE_CONTAINER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - container_dbd.txt

        Event raised under the transaction CHANGE_CONTAINER_STATUS
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised for the container upon successful execution of changeShipmentContainer.
            Data published - YDM_CHANGE_CONTAINER_STATUS.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - container_dbd.txt

        Event raised under the transaction DELETE_CONTAINER
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon deletion of the container.
            Data published - YDM_DELETE_CONTAINER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - container_dbd.txt

        Events raised during tranaction REMOVE_SHIPMENT

          ON_CANCEL:
            This event is raised when the changeShipment API is called with the CancelRemovedQuantity flag set to Y, and quantity is cancelled off the original order as a result.
              Data Published - YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL.html, YFS_REMOVE_SHIPMENT.ON_CANCEL_dtd.txt
              Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:
        The Shipment to which the container belongs should exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the container. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
